text: is my article also going up today?
I'm.behind today due to work commitments. Post lunch for me yes.
no worries was just wondering
Article's up Sam
woo
hey editors
guys
what's with changing the pronouns on my article?
the way it was done is very insensitive
and makes me look rude
and unsure how to address the issue
when in fact i had it correct
Yahenni isn't plural
THEY USE THEY
seriously
They WotC?
yes'
WOTC said
all aetherborn
Yeah, WotC said use they for Yahenni
are genderless
and they prefer They or Them
if you're going to change what I say
Ok...that's grammatically wrong, but I'll fix it.
please please please make sure you're right
NO ITS NOT
its what they prefer
and that's the point
and now someone is commenting on it
Sam, I am going to need you to chill the fuck out
This sounds like something for a 1 on 1 conversation
ok
I'm bringing it up here cause it was an editor who did the change
and I didn't know who that was
Yeah man. Let's bring it down a notch.
it's frustrating
It takes half a minute to change it back and put an editor's note
ok
olk
chilling
sorry
I'll stop
I was offended
that's all

It's only grammatically wrong because English doesn't have gender less single pronouns, I remember from a Spanish class like 10 years ago that we used to have them in English but at some point they just stopped being a thing
<@U3L7A68JC> said he'd fix it so we should all be good now
So maybe instead of putting  the editors on blast, take it to who offended you first?
what?
I'm the editor so in future, just chat with me directly.
What he said
I was offended that my editor changed my words, which I chose carefully,
OK
I'm done then
didn't know
went a little on tilt
need to step away from comp
So if the editor offended you, talk directly to the editors and let them know. We all don't need to know the personal beefs going on.
Keeps the peace a bit better as well.
As an aside to this, if we have any special notes should we message the editor directly or make a note within the draft?
Slack is a good channel for notes, putting something in the piece might get missed
Corrected
and updated

I will, in the future, take such issues up with <@U3L7A68JC> , at the beginning of this conversation I was not sure who I was directing this at, so saying here was so that the correct person could find it.
Thank you <@U3L7A68JC>
np
I apologize for going on full tilt
np
It has been a stressful day
and I didn't mean to go through the roof, I will temper mysefl before coming to you in the future
myself*
Now I'm reading about the history of how we have this grammar for singular theys
and sorry to everyone else, for upsetting you with this issue

No hurt feelings on my side at least, t is good that you care about it, it is small things like that that can cause many people to feel like outsiders suddenly when they were feeling otherwise up to that point
Thanks, <@U32LRG9NU>
thanks <@U3RJ9VDRT> I appreciate it
Plus, now I get to understand why some people use singular they and some people don't after reading about it on Wikipedia, so it's win win for me
nice, you're one of the lucky 10000

I mean, I do understand the inclination to not want to use it, as it seems like it could be unclear when distinguishing between singular and plural, especially since there is not actual way outside of context to convey it grammatically correct.
Anyway, I've been running a fever all day and meant to take a nap like two hours ago, so I'm going to do that now

I hope everyone learned something today. I really don't want a repeat of today. If you have a problem with me or Henry or someone else editorializing and we change something you wish we had not and it obscures your intent as a writer, message us privately. Don't comment on the article, and certainly don't verbally abuse anyone on the team. I think we are all on the same page, now. I think we should move on.
<@U3L7A68JC> ill have my article done in the morning tomorrow. I have to add some pictures, the decklist and a few smaller things left. I'll give you a heads up when it's done.
